result.execSummary:
The defendant Robin L. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Emergency Rescue Worker [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(7)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
COMMENCE FORTHWITH  -  
*** JOC AMENDED TO READ  -  15CF306 WAS READ-IN

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling,   AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Robin L. Smith, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and sentencing arguments made.   DE is sentenced to 54 months in the WSP; 18 months Initial confinement followed by 36 months Extended Supervision.  DE is taken into custody.  Cash Bond on Deposit in 15CF306 shall be applied.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
